About me

I'm a second year Master's student in Multilingual Communication Technology (MATIM in French) at the University of Geneva. During my 2023 Autumn semester, I took the "Web Technologies and Multimedia" course taught by Johanna Gerlach. This simple site is snapshot of some of the projects I completed in that class.

Scroll down to check out some of the projects!

NB: project descriptions were adapted from the course instructions for Technologies Web et Multim√©dia 2023.

View Resume

Projects

Responsive Design

In this project, we were asked to create a responsive page using Bootstrap. We had to ensure that the page was visible in all screen sizes and deploy it onto Github. For my example, I created a homepage of a baking blog.

See Live Source Code

JavaScript

In this project, we added interactive functionalities to an SVG image using JavaScript. When you click on one of the skeleton's bones, a corresponding description will pop up on the side.

See Live Source Code

APIs

In this project, we used Google Maps JavaScript API to create a map similar to the FTI alumni map, which includes markers to show where each alumn is now living on the map. We were able to copy a lot of the code already provided by the Google Maps API, making it a lot easier to build and adapt.

See Live Source Code

Dyanmic Website and Databases

In this project, we had to create a dynamic website using the Bottle web framework, the SQLite database and Bootstrap for the display. We were required to include: a homepage with a list of all the entries and their image, a detailed view of each entry on separate page, the ability to add an entry and a button to delete an entry. For my example, I chose to make my website a catalogue of different paintings by different artists. Users can choose from a drop-down list of artists, add an image of the painting, the painting name and image source. The artist's information is automatically populated when an artist is chosen.

See Live Source Code
